text: Pitharatus is a genus of Southeast Asian orb-weaver spiders containing the single species, Pitharatus junghuhni. It was first described by Eugène Simon in 1895 to contain the single species moved from the now obsolete "catch-all" genus Epeira. It has only been found in Malaysia and Indonesia. ==References== Category:Araneidae Category:Monotypic Araneomorphae genera Category:Spiders of Asia Category:Taxa named by Eugène Simon
title: Pitharatus
